notes.text:
An update for nss-softokn is now available for Red Hat Enterprise Linux 7.4 Advanced Update Support, Red Hat Enterprise Linux 7.4 Telco Extended Update Support, and Red Hat Enterprise Linux 7.4 Update Services for SAP Solutions.

Red Hat Product Security has rated this update as having a security impact of Moderate. A Common Vulnerability Scoring System (CVSS) base score, which gives a detailed severity rating, is available for each vulnerability from the CVE link(s) in the References section.
notes.title: Topic

notes.text:
The nss-softokn package provides the Network Security Services Softoken Cryptographic Module.

Security Fix(es):

* nss: Use-after-free in sftk_FreeSession due to improper refcounting (CVE-2019-11756)

* nss: Check length of inputs for cryptographic primitives (CVE-2019-17006)

* nss: CHACHA20-POLY1305 decryption with undersized tag leads to out-of-bounds read (CVE-2020-12403)

For more details about the security issue(s), including the impact, a CVSS score, acknowledgments, and other related information, refer to the CVE page(s) listed in the References section.
notes.title: Details

notes.text: A use-after-free flaw was found in Mozilla Network Security Services (NSS) related to PK11 session handling. An attacker could use this flaw to execute arbitrary code with the permissions of the user running the application compiled with NSS.
notes.title: Vulnerability description

notes.text: nss: Use-after-free in sftk_FreeSession due to improper refcounting
notes.title: Vulnerability summary

notes.text: This flaw was fixed in upstream nss-3.47. Exploitation of this flaw is difficult and even impossible in most cases.
notes.title: Statement

notes.text: The CVSS score(s) listed for this vulnerability do not reflect the associated product's status, and are included for informational purposes to better understand the severity of this vulnerability.
notes.title: CVSS score applicability

remediations.details:
For details on how to apply this update, which includes the changes described in this advisory, refer to:

https://access.redhat.com/articles/11258

vulnerabilities.title: nss: Use-after-free in sftk_FreeSession due to improper refcounting

notes.text: A vulnerability was discovered in nss where input text length was not checked when using certain cryptographic primitives. This could lead to a heap-buffer overflow resulting in a crash and data leak. The highest threat is to confidentiality and integrity of data as well as system availability.
notes.title: Vulnerability description

notes.text: nss: Check length of inputs for cryptographic primitives
notes.title: Vulnerability summary

notes.text: The CVSS score(s) listed for this vulnerability do not reflect the associated product's status, and are included for informational purposes to better understand the severity of this vulnerability.
notes.title: CVSS score applicability

remediations.details:
For details on how to apply this update, which includes the changes described in this advisory, refer to:

https://access.redhat.com/articles/11258

vulnerabilities.title: nss: Check length of inputs for cryptographic primitives

notes.text: A flaw was found in the way CHACHA20-POLY1305 was implemented in NSS. When using multi-part Chacha20, it could cause out-of-bounds reads. This issue was fixed by explicitly disabling multi-part ChaCha20 (which was not functioning correctly) and strictly enforcing tag length. The highest threat from this vulnerability is to confidentiality and system availability.
notes.title: Vulnerability description

notes.text: nss: CHACHA20-POLY1305 decryption with undersized tag leads to out-of-bounds read
notes.title: Vulnerability summary
